intro: Phymatanthus serra, commonly known as the serrated phymatanthus, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds.
